title: Aramaic
summary: Aramaic (Classical Syriac: 塥堋 Army; Old Aramaic: ; Imperial Aramaic: ; square script 址专指指指) is a Semitic language that originated among the Arameans in the ancient region of Syria.[1]  During its three thousand year long history,[2] Aramaic went through several stages of development. It has served as a language of public life and administration of ancient kingdoms and empires and also as a language of divine worship and religious study. It subsequently branched into several Neo-Aramaic languages that are still spoken in modern times.[3][4][5][6][7]
